Key Arguments: The legislation segregates Australians into those who can question authority and those who will be silenced.
The government and mainstream media are exempt from being accused of spreading misinformation, while smaller organizations and individuals are not.
The bill threatens freedom of speech, which is a fundamental human right as per international declarations signed by Australia.
The control of speech will be outsourced to unelected bureaucrats and digital platforms, leading to potential over-censorship.
The language of the bill is vague and open to interpretation, which could lead to future expansions of its scope.
Notable Quotes: The Government will be deemed not to have spread misinformation, but if ordinary citizens question a ruling of theirs, that could be deemed misinformation.
Without the voices of people like William Wilberforce how much longer would degradation and ill-treatment have continued?
Please vote against this Bill and protect Freedom of Speech, Communication and Expression, as we promised to protect them in 1948.
